verses.verse: So these <S%H428><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> men <S%H376><s%> ceased <S%H7673><s%> to answer <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6030><s%> <S%H853><s%> Job, <S%H347><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> he <S%H1931><s%> was righteous <S%H6662><s%> in his own eyes. <S%H5869><s%>

Then was kindled <S%H2734><s%> the wrath <S%H639><s%> of Elihu <S%H453><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Barachel <S%H1292><s%> the Buzite, <S%H940><s%> of the kindred <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4940><s%> of Ram: <S%H7410><s%> against Job <S%H347><s%> was his wrath <S%H639><s%> kindled, <S%H2734><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> he justified <S%H6663><s%> himself <S%H5315><s%> rather than God. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H430><s%>

Also against his three <S%H7969><s%> friends <S%H7453><s%> was his wrath <S%H639><s%> kindled, <S%H2734><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> <S%H834><s%> they had found <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> answer, <S%H4617><s%> and yet had condemned <S%H7561><s%> <S%H853><s%> Job. <S%H347><s%>

Now Elihu <S%H453><s%> had waited <S%H2442><s%> till <S%H853><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> had spoken, <S%H1697><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> they <S%H1992><s%> were elder <S%H2205><s%> <S%H3117><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> he.

When Elihu <S%H453><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> there was no <S%H369><s%> answer <S%H4617><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of these three <S%H7969><s%> men, <S%H376><s%> then his wrath <S%H639><s%> was kindled. <S%H2734><s%>

And Elihu <S%H453><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Barachel <S%H1292><s%> the Buzite <S%H940><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> I <S%H589><s%> am young, <S%H6810><s%> and ye <S%H859><s%> are very old; <S%H3453><s%> <S%H3117><s%> wherefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> I was afraid, <S%H2119><s%> and durst <S%H3372><s%> not show <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2331><s%> you mine opinion. <S%H1843><s%>
I said, <S%H559><s%> Days <S%H3117><s%> should speak, <S%H1696><s%> and multitude <S%H7230><s%> of years <S%H8141><s%> should teach <S%H3045><s%> wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
But <S%H403><s%> there is a spirit <S%H7307><s%> in man: <S%H582><s%> and the inspiration <S%H5397><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> giveth them understanding. <S%H995><s%>
Great <S%H7227><s%> men are not <S%H3808><s%> always wise: <S%H2449><s%> neither do the aged <S%H2205><s%> understand <S%H995><s%> judgment. <S%H4941><s%>
Therefore <S%H3651><s%> I said, <S%H559><s%> Hearken <S%H8085><s%> to me; I <S%H589><s%> also <S%H637><s%> will show <S%H2331><s%> mine opinion. <S%H1843><s%>

Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I waited <S%H3176><s%> for your words; <S%H1697><s%> I gave ear <S%H238><s%> to <S%H5704><s%> your reasons, <S%H8394><s%> whilst <S%H5704><s%> ye searched out <S%H2713><s%> what to say. <S%H4405><s%>

Yea, I attended <S%H995><s%> unto <S%H5704><s%> you, and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> there was none <S%H369><s%> of <S%H4480><s%> you that convinced <S%H3198><s%> Job, <S%H347><s%> or that answered <S%H6030><s%> his words: <S%H561><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> ye should say, <S%H559><s%> We have found out <S%H4672><s%> wisdom: <S%H2451><s%> God <S%H410><s%> thrusteth him down, <S%H5086><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> man. <S%H376><s%>
Now he hath not <S%H3808><s%> directed <S%H6186><s%> his words <S%H4405><s%> against <S%H413><s%> me: neither <S%H3808><s%> will I answer <S%H7725><s%> him with your speeches. <S%H561><s%>
They were amazed, <S%H2865><s%> they answered <S%H6030><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more: <S%H5750><s%> they left off <S%H6275><s%> <S%H4480><s%> speaking. <S%H4405><s%>

When I had waited, <S%H3176><s%> (for <S%H3588><s%> they spoke <S%H1696><s%> not, <S%H3808><s%> but <S%H3588><s%> stood still, <S%H5975><s%> and answered <S%H6030><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more;) <S%H5750><s%>
I said, I <S%H589><s%> will answer <S%H6030><s%> also <S%H637><s%> my part, <S%H2506><s%> I <S%H589><s%> also <S%H637><s%> will show <S%H2331><s%> mine opinion. <S%H1843><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> I am full <S%H4390><s%> of matter, <S%H4405><s%> the spirit <S%H7307><s%> within <S%H990><s%> me constraineth <S%H6693><s%> me.
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> my belly <S%H990><s%> is as wine <S%H3196><s%> which hath no <S%H3808><s%> vent; <S%H6605><s%> it is ready to burst <S%H1234><s%> like new <S%H2319><s%> bottles. <S%H178><s%>
I will speak, <S%H1696><s%> that I may be refreshed: <S%H7304><s%> I will open <S%H6605><s%> my lips <S%H8193><s%> and answer. <S%H6030><s%>

Let me not, <S%H408><s%> I pray you, <S%H4994><s%> accept <S%H5375><s%> any man's <S%H376><s%> person, <S%H6440><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> let me give flattering titles <S%H3655><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> man. <S%H120><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> to give flattering titles; <S%H3655><s%> in so doing my maker <S%H6213><s%> would soon <S%H4592><s%> take me away. <S%H5375><s%>
